   20: %% Description: Tests supervisor.erl
   21: 
   22: -module(supervisor_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: 
   26: %% Testserver specific export
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, init_per_testcase/2,
   29: 	 end_per_testcase/2]).
   30: 
   31: %% Internal export
   32: -export([init/1, terminate_all_children/1,
   33:          middle9212/0, gen_server9212/0, handle_info/2]).
   34: 
   35: %% API tests
   36: -export([ sup_start_normal/1, sup_start_ignore_init/1, 
   37: 	  sup_start_ignore_child/1, sup_start_ignore_temporary_child/1,
   38: 	  sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child/1,
   39: 	  sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child_simple/1,
   40:           sup_start_ignore_permanent_child_start_child_simple/1,
   41: 	  sup_start_error_return/1, sup_start_fail/1,
   42:           sup_start_child_returns_error/1,
   43:           sup_start_restart_child_returns_error/1,
   44:           sup_start_child_returns_error_simple/1,
   45: 	  sup_start_map/1, sup_start_map_simple/1,
   46: 	  sup_start_map_faulty_specs/1,
   47: 	  sup_stop_infinity/1, sup_stop_timeout/1, sup_stop_timeout_dynamic/1,
   48: 	  sup_stop_brutal_kill/1, sup_stop_brutal_kill_dynamic/1,
   49:           sup_stop_race/1, sup_stop_non_shutdown_exit_dynamic/1,
   50: 	  child_adm/1, child_adm_simple/1, child_specs/1, child_specs_map/1,
   51: 	  extra_return/1, sup_flags/1]).
   52: 
   53: %% Tests concept permanent, transient and temporary 
   54: -export([ permanent_normal/1, transient_normal/1,
   55: 	  temporary_normal/1,
   56: 	  permanent_shutdown/1, transient_shutdown/1,
   57: 	  temporary_shutdown/1,
   58:           faulty_application_shutdown/1,
   59: 	  permanent_abnormal/1, transient_abnormal/1,
   60: 	  temporary_abnormal/1, temporary_bystander/1]).
   61: 
   62: %% Restart strategy tests 
   63: -export([ multiple_restarts/1,
   64: 	  one_for_one/1,
   65: 	  one_for_one_escalation/1, one_for_all/1,
   66: 	  one_for_all_escalation/1, one_for_all_other_child_fails_restart/1,
   67: 	  simple_one_for_one/1, simple_one_for_one_escalation/1,
   68:           simple_one_for_one_corruption/1,
   69: 	  rest_for_one/1, rest_for_one_escalation/1,
   70: 	  rest_for_one_other_child_fails_restart/1,
   71: 	  simple_one_for_one_extra/1, simple_one_for_one_shutdown/1]).
   72: 
   73: %% Significant child tests
   74: -export([ nonsignificant_temporary/1, nonsignificant_transient/1,
   75: 	  significant_temporary/1, significant_transient/1,
   76: 	  significant_simple/1, significant_bystander/1,
   77: 	  significant_escalation/1, significant_upgrade_never_any/1,
   78: 	  significant_upgrade_any_never/1, significant_upgrade_never_all/1,
   79: 	  significant_upgrade_all_never/1, significant_upgrade_any_all/1,
   80: 	  significant_upgrade_all_any/1, significant_upgrade_child/1]).
   81: 
   82: %% Misc tests
   83: -export([child_unlink/1, tree/1, count_children/1, count_children_supervisor/1,
   84: 	 count_restarting_children/1, get_callback_module/1,
   85: 	 do_not_save_start_parameters_for_temporary_children/1,
   86: 	 do_not_save_child_specs_for_temporary_children/1,
   87: 	 simple_one_for_one_scale_many_temporary_children/1,
   88:          simple_global_supervisor/1, hanging_restart_loop/1,
   89: 	 hanging_restart_loop_rest_for_one/1,
   90: 	 hanging_restart_loop_simple/1, code_change/1, code_change_map/1,
   91: 	 code_change_simple/1, code_change_simple_map/1,
   92:          order_of_children/1, scale_start_stop_many_children/1,
   93:          format_log_1/1, format_log_2/1]).
   94: 
   95: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   96: 
   97: suite() ->
   98:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   99:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
  100: 
  101: all() -> 
  102:     [{group, sup_start}, {group, sup_start_map}, {group, sup_stop}, child_adm,
  103:      child_adm_simple, extra_return, child_specs, child_specs_map, sup_flags,
  104:      multiple_restarts,
  105:      {group, restart_one_for_one},
  106:      {group, restart_one_for_all},
  107:      {group, restart_simple_one_for_one},
  108:      {group, restart_rest_for_one},
  109:      {group, normal_termination},
  110:      {group, shutdown_termination},
  111:      {group, abnormal_termination}, child_unlink, tree,
  112:      {group, significant},
  113:      count_children, count_children_supervisor, count_restarting_children,
  114:      get_callback_module,
  115:      do_not_save_start_parameters_for_temporary_children,
  116:      do_not_save_child_specs_for_temporary_children,
  117:      simple_one_for_one_scale_many_temporary_children, temporary_bystander,
  118:      simple_global_supervisor, hanging_restart_loop,
  119:      hanging_restart_loop_rest_for_one, hanging_restart_loop_simple,
  120:      code_change, code_change_map, code_change_simple, code_change_simple_map,
  121:      order_of_children, scale_start_stop_many_children,
  122:      format_log_1, format_log_2].
  123: 
  124: groups() -> 
  125:     [{sup_start, [],
  126:       [sup_start_normal, sup_start_ignore_init,
  127:        sup_start_ignore_child, sup_start_ignore_temporary_child,
  128:        sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child,
  129:        sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child_simple,
  130:        sup_start_ignore_permanent_child_start_child_simple,
  131:        sup_start_error_return, sup_start_fail,
  132:        sup_start_child_returns_error, sup_start_restart_child_returns_error,
  133:        sup_start_child_returns_error_simple
  134:       ]},
  135:      {sup_start_map, [],
  136:       [sup_start_map, sup_start_map_simple, sup_start_map_faulty_specs]},
  137:      {sup_stop, [],
  138:       [sup_stop_infinity, sup_stop_timeout, sup_stop_timeout_dynamic,
  139:        sup_stop_brutal_kill, sup_stop_brutal_kill_dynamic,
  140:        sup_stop_race, sup_stop_non_shutdown_exit_dynamic]},
  141:      {normal_termination, [],
  142:       [permanent_normal, transient_normal, temporary_normal]},
  143:      {shutdown_termination, [],
  144:       [permanent_shutdown, transient_shutdown, temporary_shutdown,
  145:        faulty_application_shutdown]},
  146:      {abnormal_termination, [],
  147:       [permanent_abnormal, transient_abnormal,
  148:        temporary_abnormal]},
  149:      {restart_one_for_one, [],
  150:       [one_for_one, one_for_one_escalation]},
  151:      {restart_one_for_all, [],
  152:       [one_for_all, one_for_all_escalation,
  153:        one_for_all_other_child_fails_restart]},
  154:      {restart_simple_one_for_one, [],
  155:       [simple_one_for_one, simple_one_for_one_shutdown,
  156:        simple_one_for_one_extra, simple_one_for_one_escalation,
  157:        simple_one_for_one_corruption]},
  158:      {restart_rest_for_one, [],
  159:       [rest_for_one, rest_for_one_escalation,
  160:        rest_for_one_other_child_fails_restart]},
  161:      {significant, [],
  162:       [nonsignificant_temporary, nonsignificant_transient,
  163:        significant_temporary, significant_transient,
  164:        significant_simple, significant_bystander,
  165:        significant_escalation,
  166:        significant_upgrade_never_any, significant_upgrade_any_never,
  167:        significant_upgrade_never_all, significant_upgrade_all_never,
  168:        significant_upgrade_any_all, significant_upgrade_all_any,
  169:        significant_upgrade_child]}].
  170: 
  171: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  172:     Config.
  173: 
  174: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  175:     ok.
  176: 
  177: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  178:     Config.
  179: 
  180: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  181:     Config.
  182: 
  183: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  184:     Config.
  185: 
  186: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
  187:     %% Clean up to avoid unnecessary error reports in the shell
  188:     case whereis(sup_test) of
  189:         SupPid when is_pid(SupPid) ->
  190:             unlink(SupPid),
  191:             exit(SupPid,shutdown),
  192:             ok;
  193:         _ ->
  194:             error
  195:     end,
  196:     ok.
  197: 
  198: start_link(InitResult) ->
  199:     supervisor:start_link({local, sup_test}, ?MODULE, InitResult).
  200: 
  201: %% Simulate different supervisors callback.  
  202: init(fail) ->
  203:     erlang:error({badmatch,2});
  204: init(InitResult) ->
  205:     InitResult.
  206: 
  207: %% Respect proplist return of supervisor:count_children
  208: get_child_counts(Supervisor) ->
  209:     Counts = supervisor:count_children(Supervisor),
  210:     [proplists:get_value(specs, Counts),
  211:      proplists:get_value(active, Counts),
  212:      proplists:get_value(supervisors, Counts),
  213:      proplists:get_value(workers, Counts)].
  214: 
  215: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  216: %% Test cases starts here.
  217: %% -------------------------------------------------------------------------
  218: %% Tests that the supervisor process starts correctly and that it can
  219: %% be terminated gracefully.
  220: sup_start_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  221:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  222:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  223:     terminate(Pid, shutdown).
  224: 
  225: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  226: %% Tests what happens if init-callback returns ignore.
  227: sup_start_ignore_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  228:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  229:     ignore = start_link(ignore),
  230:     check_exit_reason(normal).
  231: 
  232: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  233: %% Tests what happens if init-callback returns ignore.
  234: sup_start_ignore_child(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  235:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  236:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  237:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [ignore]}, 
  238: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  239:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent,
  240: 	      1000, worker, []},
  241: 
  242:     {ok, undefined} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  243:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  244: 
  245:     [{child2, CPid2, worker, []},{child1, undefined, worker, []}]
  246: 	= supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  247:     [2,1,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
  248: 
  249: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  250: %% Tests what happens if child's init-callback returns ignore for a
  251: %% temporary child when ChildSpec is returned directly from supervisor
  252: %% init callback.
  253: %% Child spec shall NOT be saved!!!
  254: sup_start_ignore_temporary_child(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  255:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  256:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [ignore]},
  257: 	      temporary, 1000, worker, []},
  258:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary,
  259: 	      1000, worker, []},
  260:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child1,Child2]}}),
  261: 
  262:     [{child2, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  263:     true = is_pid(CPid2),
  264:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
  265: 
  266: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  267: %% Tests what happens if child's init-callback returns ignore for a
  268: %% temporary child when child is started with start_child/2.
  269: %% Child spec shall NOT be saved!!!
  270: sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  271:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  272:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  273:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [ignore]},
  274: 	      temporary, 1000, worker, []},
  275:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary,
  276: 	      1000, worker, []},
  277: 
  278:     {ok, undefined} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  279:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  280: 
  281:     [{child2, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  282:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
  283: 
  284: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  285: %% Tests what happens if child's init-callback returns ignore for a
  286: %% temporary child when child is started with start_child/2, and the
  287: %% supervisor is simple_one_for_one.
  288: %% Child spec shall NOT be saved!!!
  289: sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child_simple(Config)
  290:   when is_list(Config) ->
  291:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  292:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [ignore]},
  293: 	      temporary, 1000, worker, []},
  294:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child1]}}),
  295: 
  296:     {ok, undefined} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  297:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  298: 
  299:     [{undefined, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  300:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
  301: 
  302: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  303: %% Tests what happens if child's init-callback returns ignore for a
  304: %% permanent child when child is started with start_child/2, and the
  305: %% supervisor is simple_one_for_one.
  306: %% Child spec shall NOT be saved!!!
  307: sup_start_ignore_permanent_child_start_child_simple(Config)
  308:   when is_list(Config) ->
  309:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  310:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [ignore]},
  311: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  312:     {ok, Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child1]}}),
  313: 
  314:     {ok, undefined} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  315:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  316: 
  317:     [{undefined, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  318:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  319: 
  320:     %% Regression test: check that the supervisor terminates without error.
  321:     exit(Pid, shutdown),
  322:     check_exit_reason(Pid, shutdown).
  323: 
  324: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  325: %% Tests what happens if init-callback returns a invalid value.
  326: sup_start_error_return(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  327:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  328:     {error, Term} = start_link(invalid),
  329:     check_exit_reason(Term).
  330: 
  331: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  332: %% Tests what happens if init-callback fails.
  333: sup_start_fail(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  334:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  335:     {error, Term} = start_link(fail),
  336:     check_exit_reason(Term).
  337: 
  338: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  339: %% Test what happens when the start function for a child returns
  340: %% {error,Reason} or some other term().
  341: sup_start_restart_child_returns_error(_Config) ->
  342:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  343:     Child = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [error]},
  344:               permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  345:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  346: 
  347:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  348:     {error,{function_clause,_}} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test,child1),
  349: 
  350:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  351:     ok.
  352: 
  353: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  354: %% Test what happens when the start function for a child returns
  355: %% {error,Reason} or some other term().
  356: sup_start_child_returns_error(_Config) ->
  357:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  358:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [{return,{error,reason}}]},
  359:               permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  360:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, [{return,error_reason}]},
  361:               permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  362:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  363: 
  364:     {error,{reason,_}} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test,Child1),
  365:     {error,{error_reason,_}} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test,Child2),
  366: 
  367:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  368:     ok.
  369: 
  370: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  371: %% Test what happens when the start function for a child returns
  372: %% {error,Reason} - simple_one_for_one
  373: sup_start_child_returns_error_simple(_Config) ->
  374:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  375:     Child = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  376:              permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  377:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  378: 
  379:     {error,reason} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test,[{return,{error,reason}}]),
  380:     {error,error_reason} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test,[{return,error_reason}]),
  381: 
  382:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  383:     ok.
  384: 
  385: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  386: %% Tests that the supervisor process starts correctly with map
  387: %% startspec, and that the full childspec can be read.
  388: sup_start_map(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  389:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  390:     Child1 = #{id=>child1, start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []}},
  391:     Child2 = #{id=>child2,
  392: 	       start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  393: 	       shutdown=>brutal_kill},
  394:     Child3 = #{id=>child3,
  395: 	       start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  396: 	       type=>supervisor},
  397:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {#{}, [Child1,Child2,Child3]}}),
  398: 
  399:     %% Check default values
  400:     {ok,#{id:=child1,
  401: 	  start:={supervisor_1,start_child,[]},
  402: 	  restart:=permanent,
  403: 	  shutdown:=5000,
  404: 	  type:=worker,
  405: 	  modules:=[supervisor_1]}} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, child1),
  406:     {ok,#{id:=child2,
  407: 	  start:={supervisor_1,start_child,[]},
  408: 	  restart:=permanent,
  409: 	  shutdown:=brutal_kill,
  410: 	  type:=worker,
  411: 	  modules:=[supervisor_1]}} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, child2),
  412:     {ok,#{id:=child3,
  413: 	  start:={supervisor_1,start_child,[]},
  414: 	  restart:=permanent,
  415: 	  shutdown:=infinity,
  416: 	  type:=supervisor,
  417: 	  modules:=[supervisor_1]}} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, child3),
  418:     {error,not_found} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, child4),
  419:     terminate(Pid, shutdown).
  420: 
  421: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  422: %% Tests that the supervisor process starts correctly with map
  423: %% startspec, and that the full childspec can be read when using
  424: %% simple_one_for_one strategy.
  425: sup_start_map_simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  426:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  427:     SupFlags = #{strategy=>simple_one_for_one},
  428:     ChildSpec = #{id=>undefined,
  429: 		  start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  430: 		  restart=>temporary},
  431:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {SupFlags, [ChildSpec]}}),
  432: 
  433:     {ok, Child1} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  434:     {ok, Child2} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  435:     {ok, Child3} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  436: 
  437:     Spec = ChildSpec#{type=>worker, shutdown=>5000, modules=>[supervisor_1],
  438: 		      significant=>false},
  439: 
  440:     {ok, Spec} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, Child1),
  441:     {ok, Spec} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, Child2),
  442:     {ok, Spec} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, Child3),
  443:     {error,not_found} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, self()),
  444:     terminate(Pid, shutdown).
  445: 
  446: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  447: %% Tests that the supervisor produces good error messages when start-
  448: %% and child specs are faulty.
  449: sup_start_map_faulty_specs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  450:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  451:     Child1 = #{start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []}},
  452:     Child2 = #{id=>child2},
  453:     Child3 = #{id=>child3,
  454: 	       start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  455: 	       silly_flag=>true},
  456:     Child4 = child4,
  457:     {error,{start_spec,missing_id}} = start_link({ok, {#{}, [Child1]}}),
  458:     {error,{start_spec,missing_start}} = start_link({ok, {#{}, [Child2]}}),
  459:     {ok,Pid} = start_link({ok, {#{}, [Child3]}}),
  460:     terminate(Pid,shutdown),
  461:     {error,{start_spec,{invalid_child_spec,child4}}} =
  462: 	start_link({ok, {#{}, [Child4]}}).
  463: 
  464: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  465: %% See sup_stop/1 when Shutdown = infinity, this walue is allowed for
  466: %% children of type supervisor _AND_ worker.
  467: sup_stop_infinity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  468:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  469:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  470:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, 
  471: 	      permanent, infinity, supervisor, []},
  472:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent,
  473: 	      infinity, worker, []},
  474:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  475:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  476:     link(CPid1),
  477:     link(CPid2),
  478: 
  479:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  480:     check_exit_reason(CPid1, shutdown),
  481:     check_exit_reason(CPid2, shutdown).
  482: 
  483: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  484: %% See sup_stop/1 when Shutdown = 1000
  485: sup_stop_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  486:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  487:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  488:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, 
  489: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  490:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent,
  491: 	      1000, worker, []},
  492:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  493:     link(CPid1),
  494:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  495:     link(CPid2),
  496: 
  497:     CPid2 ! {sleep, 200000},
  498: 
  499:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  500: 
  501:     check_exit_reason(CPid1, shutdown),
  502:     check_exit_reason(CPid2, killed).
  503: 
  504: sup_stop_timeout_dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  505:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  506:     Child = {child, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary, 1000, worker, []},
  507:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  508:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  509:     link(CPid1),
  510:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  511:     link(CPid2),
  512:     CPid2 ! {sleep, 200000},
  513:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  514:     check_exit_reason(Pid, shutdown),
  515:     check_exit_reason(CPid1, shutdown),
  516:     check_exit_reason(CPid2, killed).
  517: 
  518: 
  519: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  520: %% See sup_stop/1 when Shutdown = brutal_kill
  521: sup_stop_brutal_kill(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  522:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  523:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  524:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, 
  525: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  526:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent,
  527: 	      brutal_kill, worker, []},
  528:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  529:     link(CPid1),
  530:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  531:     link(CPid2),
  532: 
  533:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  534: 
  535:     check_exit_reason(CPid1, shutdown),
  536:     check_exit_reason(CPid2, killed).
  537: 
  538: sup_stop_brutal_kill_dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  539:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  540:     Child = {child, {supervisor_4, start_child, []}, temporary, brutal_kill, worker, []},
  541:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  542:     CPids = lists:map(
  543:         fun (_) ->
  544:             {ok, CPid} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  545:             link(CPid),
  546:             CPid
  547:         end,
  548:         lists:seq(1, 10)),
  549:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  550:     check_exit_reason(Pid, shutdown),
  551:     lists:foreach(
  552:         fun (CPid) ->
  553:             check_exit_reason(CPid, killed)
  554:         end,
  555:         CPids
  556:     ).
  557: 
  558: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  559: %% Tests that a supervisor completes its shutdown properly while children
  560: %% exit by themselves for reasons other than shutdown
  561: sup_stop_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  562:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  563:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  564:     {ok, CPidA} = supervisor:start_child(Pid,
  565:         #{id => child_a,
  566:           start => {supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  567:           restart => temporary,
  568:           shutdown => 1000}),
  569:     link(CPidA),
  570:     CPids = lists:foldl(
  571:         fun ({Restart, Reason}, Acc) ->
  572:             {ok, CPid} = supervisor:start_child(Pid,
  573:                 #{id => {child, make_ref()},
  574:                   start => {supervisor_4, start_child, [Reason]},
  575:                   restart => Restart,
  576:                   shutdown => 1000
  577:                 }),
  578:             link(CPid),
  579:             Acc#{CPid => Reason}
  580:         end,
  581:         #{},
  582:         [
  583:             {Restart, Reason}
  584:             || Restart <- [temporary, transient, permanent],
  585:                Reason <- [normal, shutdown, {shutdown, test}, other]
  586:         ]
  587:     ),
  588:     {ok, CPidZ} = supervisor:start_child(Pid,
  589:         #{
  590:             id => child_z,
  591:             start => {supervisor_2, start_child, [1000]},
  592:             restart => temporary,
  593:             shutdown => 2000
  594:         }),
  595:     link(CPidZ),
  596:     Self = self(),
  597:     spawn_link(
  598:         fun () ->
  599:             timer:sleep(200),
  600:             maps:foreach(
  601:                 fun (CPid, _) ->
  602:                     CPid ! stop
  603:                 end,
  604:                 CPids
  605:             ),
  606:             unlink(Self)
  607:         end
  608:     ),
  609:     ok = terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  610:     check_exit_reason(Pid, shutdown),
  611:     check_exit_reason(CPidZ, shutdown),
  612:     maps:foreach(
  613:         fun (CPid, Reason) ->
  614:             check_exit_reason(CPid, Reason)
  615:         end,
  616:         CPids),
  617:     check_exit_reason(CPidA, shutdown).
  618: 
  619: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  620: %% Tests that a simple_one_for_one supervisor shuts down correctly when
  621: %% some children exit with a reason other than shutdown
  622: sup_stop_non_shutdown_exit_dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  623:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  624:     lists:foreach(
  625:         fun (Restart) ->
  626:             Child = {child, {supervisor_4, start_child, []}, Restart, 5000, worker, []},
  627:             {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  628:             CPids = lists:foldl(
  629:                 fun (Reason, Acc) ->
  630:                     {ok, CPid} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, [Reason]),
  631:                     link(CPid),
  632:                     Acc#{CPid => Reason}
  633:                 end,
  634:                 #{},
  635:                 [normal, shutdown, {shutdown, test}, other]
  636:             ),
  637:             ok = terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  638:             check_exit_reason(Pid, shutdown),
  639:             maps:foreach(
  640:                 fun (CPid, Reason) ->
  641:                     check_exit_reason(CPid, Reason)
  642:                 end,
  643:                 CPids)
  644:         end,
  645:         [temporary, transient, permanent]
  646:     ).
  647: 
  648: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  649: %% The start function provided to start a child may return {ok, Pid}
  650: %% or {ok, Pid, Info}, if it returns the latter check that the
  651: %% supervisor ignores the Info, and includes it unchanged in return
  652: %% from start_child/2 and restart_child/2.
  653: extra_return(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  654:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  655:     Child = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [extra_return]}, 
  656: 	     permanent, 1000,
  657: 	     worker, []},
  658:     {ok, _Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  659:     [{child1, CPid, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  660:     link(CPid),
  661:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, hej),
  662:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, hej),
  663:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, hej),
  664:     {error, running} = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, child1),
  665:     {error, running} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  666:     [{child1, CPid, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  667:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  668: 
  669:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  670:     check_exit_reason(CPid, shutdown),
  671:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  672:     [1,0,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  673: 
  674:     {ok, CPid2,extra_return} =
  675: 	supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  676:     [{child1, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  677:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  678: 
  679:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  680:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  681:     ok = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, child1),
  682:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  683:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  684:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  685: 
  686:     {ok, CPid3, extra_return} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child),
  687:     [{child1, CPid3, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  688:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  689: 
  690:     %% Check that it can be automatically restarted
  691:     terminate(CPid3, abnormal),
  692:     [{child1, CPid4, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  693:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  694:     if (not is_pid(CPid4)) orelse CPid4=:=CPid3 ->
  695:             ct:fail({not_restarted,CPid3,CPid4});
  696:        true ->
  697:             ok
  698:     end.
  699: 
  700: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  701: %% Test API functions start_child/2, terminate_child/2, delete_child/2
  702: %% restart_child/2, which_children/1, count_children/1. Only correct
  703: %% childspecs are used, handling of incorrect childspecs is tested in
  704: %% child_specs/1.
  705: child_adm(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  706:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  707:     Child = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
  708: 	     worker, []},
  709:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  710: 
  711:     %% Test that supervisors of static nature are hibernated after start
  712:     {current_function, {erlang, hibernate, 3}} =
  713: 	process_info(Pid, current_function),
  714: 
  715:     [{child1, CPid, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  716:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  717:     link(CPid),
  718:     %% Start of an already runnig process 
  719:     {error,{already_started, CPid}} =
  720: 	supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child),
  721: 
  722:     %% Termination
  723:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, hej),
  724:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call, _}}} =
  725: 	(catch supervisor:terminate_child(foo, child1)),
  726:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  727:     check_exit_reason(CPid, shutdown),
  728:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  729:     [1,0,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  730:     %% Like deleting something that does not exist, it will succeed!
  731:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  732: 
  733:     %% Start of already existing but not running process 
  734:     {error,already_present} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child),
  735: 
  736:     %% Restart
  737:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  738:     [{child1, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  739:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  740:     {error, running} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  741:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child2),
  742: 
  743:     %% Deletion
  744:     {error, running} = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, child1),
  745:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, hej),
  746:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call, _}}} =
  747: 	(catch supervisor:delete_child(foo, child1)),
  748:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  749:     ok = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, child1),
  750:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  751:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  752:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  753: 
  754:     %% Start
  755:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call, _}}} =
  756: 	(catch supervisor:start_child(foo, Child)),
  757:     {ok, CPid3} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child),
  758:     [{child1, CPid3, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  759:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  760: 
  761:     %% Terminate with Pid not allowed when not simple_one_for_one
  762:     {error,not_found} = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, CPid3),
  763:     [{child1, CPid3, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  764:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  765: 
  766:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call,[foo,which_children,infinity]}}}
  767: 	= (catch supervisor:which_children(foo)),
  768:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call,[foo,count_children,infinity]}}}
  769: 	= (catch supervisor:count_children(foo)),
  770:     ok.
  771: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  772: %% The API functions terminate_child/2, delete_child/2 restart_child/2
  773: %% are not valid for a simple_one_for_one supervisor check that the
  774: %% correct error message is returned.
  775: child_adm_simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  776:     Child = {child, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
  777: 	     worker, []},
  778:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  779: 
  780:        %% Test that supervisors of dynamic nature are not hibernated after start
  781:     {current_function, {_, Function, _}} =
  782: 	process_info(Pid, current_function),
  783:     true = Function =/= hibernate,
  784: 
  785:     %% In simple_one_for_one all children are added dynamically 
  786:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  787:     [1,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  788: 
  789:     %% Start
  790:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call, _}}} =
  791: 	(catch supervisor:start_child(foo, [])),
  792:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  793:     [{undefined, CPid1, worker, []}] =
  794: 	supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  795:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  796: 
  797:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  798:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  799:     2 = length(Children),
  800:     true = lists:member({undefined, CPid2, worker, []}, Children),
  801:     true = lists:member({undefined, CPid1, worker, []}, Children),
  802:     [1,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  803: 
  804:     %% Termination
  805:     {error, simple_one_for_one} = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  806:     [1,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  807:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test,CPid1),
  808:     [_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  809:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  810:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(CPid1),
  811:     %% Terminate non-existing proccess is ok
  812:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test,CPid1),
  813:     [_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  814:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  815:     %% Terminate pid which is not a child of this supervisor is not ok
  816:     NoChildPid = spawn_link(fun() -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  817:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, NoChildPid),
  818:     true = erlang:is_process_alive(NoChildPid),
  819: 
  820:     %% Restart
  821:     {error, simple_one_for_one} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  822: 
  823:     %% Deletion
  824:     {error, simple_one_for_one} = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, child1),
  825:     ok.
  826: 
  827: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  828: %% Tests child specs (tuple form), invalid formats should be rejected.
  829: child_specs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  830:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  831:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  832:     {error, _} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, hej),
  833: 
  834:     %% Bad child specs 
  835:     B1 = {child, mfa, permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  836:     B2 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, prmanent, 1000, worker, []}, 
  837:     B3 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, -10, worker, []},
  838:     B4 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, 10, wrker, []},
  839:     B5 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, 1000, worker, dy},
  840:     B6 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, 1000, worker, [1,2,3]},
  841: 
  842:     {error, {invalid_mfa,mfa}} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B1),
  843:     {error, {invalid_restart_type, prmanent}} =
  844: 	supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B2),
  845:     {error,  {invalid_shutdown,-10}}
  846: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B3),
  847:     {error, {invalid_child_type,wrker}}
  848: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B4),
  849:     {error, {invalid_modules,dy}}
  850: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B5),
  851: 
  852:     {error, {badarg, _}} = supervisor:check_childspecs(B1), % should be list
  853:     {error, {invalid_mfa,mfa}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B1]),
  854:     {error, {invalid_restart_type,prmanent}} =
  855: 	supervisor:check_childspecs([B2]),
  856:     {error, {invalid_shutdown,-10}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B3]),
  857:     {error, {invalid_child_type,wrker}}
  858: 	= supervisor:check_childspecs([B4]),
  859:     {error, {invalid_modules,dy}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B5]),
  860:     {error, {invalid_module, 1}} =
  861: 	supervisor:check_childspecs([B6]),
  862: 
  863:     lists:foreach(
  864: 	fun (ChildSpec) ->
  865: 	    ok = supervisor:check_childspecs([ChildSpec])
  866: 	end,
  867: 	[
  868: 	    {child, {m, f, [a]}, Restart, Shutdown, Type, Modules}
  869: 	    ||
  870: 		Restart <- [permanent, transient, temporary],
  871: 		Shutdown <- [0, 1000, infinity, brutal_kill],
  872: 		Type <- [supervisor, worker],
  873: 		Modules <- [dynamic, [], [m], [m1, m2]]
  874: 	]
  875:     ),
  876: 
  877:     C1 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, infinity, supervisor, []},
  878:     C2 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, 1000, supervisor, []},
  879: 
  880:     {error,{duplicate_child_name,child}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([C1,C2]),
  881: 
  882:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  883: 
  884:     %% Faulty child specs in supervisor start
  885:     {error, {start_spec, {invalid_mfa, mfa}}} =
  886: 	 start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [B1]}}),
  887:     {error, {start_spec, {invalid_restart_type, prmanent}}} =
  888: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [B2]}}),
  889: 
  890:     %% simple_one_for_one needs exactly one child
  891:     {error,{bad_start_spec,[]}} =
  892: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  893:     {error,{bad_start_spec,[C1,C2]}} =
  894: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [C1,C2]}}),
  895: 
  896:     ok.
  897: 
  898: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  899: %% Tests child specs (map form), invalid formats should be rejected.
  900: child_specs_map(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  901:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  902:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {#{}, []}}),
  903:     {error, _} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, hej),
  904: 
  905:     CS0 = #{id => child, start => {m, f, [a]}},
  906: 
  907:     %% Bad child specs 
  908:     B1 = #{},
  909:     B2 = #{id => child},
  910:     B3 = #{start => {m, f, [a]}},
  911:     B4 = CS0#{start => mfa},
  912:     B5 = CS0#{restart => prmanent}, 
  913:     B6 = CS0#{shutdown => -10},
  914:     B7 = CS0#{type => wrker},
  915:     B8 = CS0#{modules => dy},
  916:     B9 = CS0#{modules => [1,2,3]},
  917:     B10 = CS0#{significant => 'maybe'},
  918: 
  919:     {error, missing_id} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B1),
  920:     {error, missing_start} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B2),
  921:     {error, missing_id} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B3),
  922:     {error, {invalid_mfa,mfa}} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B4),
  923:     {error, {invalid_restart_type, prmanent}} =
  924: 	supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B5),
  925:     {error,  {invalid_shutdown,-10}}
  926: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B6),
  927:     {error, {invalid_child_type,wrker}}
  928: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B7),
  929:     {error, {invalid_modules,dy}}
  930: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B8),
  931: 
  932:     {error, {badarg, _}} = supervisor:check_childspecs(B1), % should be list
  933:     {error, missing_id} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B1]),
  934:     {error, missing_start} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B2]),
  935:     {error, missing_id} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B3]),
  936:     {error, {invalid_mfa,mfa}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B4]),
  937:     {error, {invalid_restart_type,prmanent}} =
  938: 	supervisor:check_childspecs([B5]),
  939:     {error, {invalid_shutdown,-10}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B6]),
  940:     {error, {invalid_child_type,wrker}}
  941: 	= supervisor:check_childspecs([B7]),
  942:     {error, {invalid_modules,dy}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B8]),
  943:     {error, {invalid_module, 1}} =
  944: 	supervisor:check_childspecs([B9]),
  945:     {error, {invalid_significant, 'maybe'}} =
  946: 	supervisor:check_childspecs([B10]),
  947: 
  948:     CSFilter = fun (CS) -> maps:filter(fun (_, V) -> V =/= undefined end, CS) end,
  949:     lists:foreach(
  950: 	fun
  951: 	    ({never, ChildSpec = #{significant := true}}) ->
  952: 		ChildSpec1 = CSFilter(ChildSpec),
  953: 		{error, {bad_combination, BadOpts}} =
  954: 		    supervisor:check_childspecs([ChildSpec1], never),
  955: 		[{auto_shutdown, never}, {significant, true}] = lists:sort(BadOpts);
  956: 	    ({AutoShutdown, ChildSpec = #{restart := undefined, significant := true}}) ->
  957: 		ChildSpec1 = CSFilter(ChildSpec),
  958: 		{error, {bad_combination, BadOpts}} =
  959: 		    supervisor:check_childspecs([ChildSpec1], AutoShutdown),
  960: 		[{restart, permanent}, {significant, true}] = lists:sort(BadOpts);
  961: 	    ({AutoShutdown, ChildSpec = #{restart := permanent, significant := true}}) ->
  962: 		ChildSpec1 = CSFilter(ChildSpec),
  963: 		{error, {bad_combination, BadOpts}} =
  964: 		    supervisor:check_childspecs([ChildSpec1], AutoShutdown),
  965: 		[{restart, permanent}, {significant, true}] = lists:sort(BadOpts);
  966: 	    ({AutoShutdown, ChildSpec}) ->
  967: 		ChildSpec1 = CSFilter(ChildSpec),
  968: 		ok = supervisor:check_childspecs([ChildSpec1], AutoShutdown)
  969: 	end,
  970: 	[
  971: 	    {AutoShutdown,
  972: 	     CS0#{restart => Restart,
  973: 		  shutdown => Shutdown,
  974: 		  type => Type,
  975: 		  modules => Modules,
  976: 		  significant => Significant,
  977: 		  dummy => Dummy}}
  978: 	    ||
  979: 		AutoShutdown <- [undefined, never, any_significant, all_significant],
  980: 		Restart <- [undefined, permanent, transient, temporary],
  981: 		Shutdown <- [undefined, 0, 1000, infinity, brutal_kill],
  982: 		Type <- [undefined, supervisor, worker],
  983: 		Modules <- [undefined, dynamic, [], [m], [m1, m2]],
  984: 		Significant <- [undefined, true, false],
  985: 		Dummy <- [undefined, dummy]
  986: 	]
  987:     ),
  988: 
  989:     {error,{duplicate_child_name,child}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([CS0,CS0]),
  990: 
  991:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  992: 
  993:     %% Faulty child specs in supervisor start
  994:     {error, {start_spec, {invalid_mfa, mfa}}} =
  995: 	 start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [B4]}}),
  996:     {error, {start_spec, {invalid_restart_type, prmanent}}} =
  997: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [B5]}}),
  998: 
  999:     %% simple_one_for_one needs exactly one child
 1000:     {error,{bad_start_spec,[]}} =
 1001: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1002:     {error,{bad_start_spec,[CS0,CS0]}} =
 1003: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [CS0,CS0]}}),
 1004: 
 1005:     %% auto_shutdown => never should not accept significant children
 1006:     {error, {start_spec, {bad_combination, _}}} =
 1007: 	start_link({ok, {#{auto_shutdown => never}, [CS0#{significant => true}]}}),
 1008: 
 1009:     ok.
 1010: 
 1011: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1012: %% Test error handling of supervisor flags
 1013: sup_flags(_Config) ->
 1014:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
 1015:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_strategy,_}}} =
 1016: 	start_link({ok, {{none_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1017:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_strategy,_}}} =
 1018: 	start_link({ok, {#{strategy=>none_for_one}, []}}),
 1019:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_intensity,_}}} =
 1020: 	start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, infinity, 3600}, []}}),
 1021:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_intensity,_}}} =
 1022: 	start_link({ok, {#{intensity=>infinity}, []}}),
 1023:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_period,_}}} =
 1024: 	start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 0}, []}}),
 1025:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_period,_}}} =
 1026: 	start_link({ok, {#{period=>0}, []}}),
 1027:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_period,_}}} =
 1028: 	start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, infinity}, []}}),
 1029:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_period,_}}} =
 1030: 	start_link({ok, {#{period=>infinity}, []}}),
 1031:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_auto_shutdown,_}}} =
 1032: 	start_link({ok, {#{auto_shutdown=>sometimes}, []}}),
 1033: 
 1034:     %% SupFlags other than a map or a 3-tuple
 1035:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_type,_}}} =
 1036: 	start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2}, []}}),
 1037: 
 1038:     %% Unexpected flags are ignored
 1039:     {ok,Pid} = start_link({ok,{#{silly_flag=>true},[]}}),
 1040:     terminate(Pid,shutdown),
 1041: 
 1042:     ok.
 1043: 
 1044: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1045: %% A permanent child should always be restarted.
 1046: permanent_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1047:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1048:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1049: 	      worker, []},
 1050: 
 1051:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1052: 
 1053:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, normal),
 1054: 
 1055:     [{child1, Pid ,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1056:     case is_pid(Pid) of
 1057: 	true ->
 1058: 	    ok;
 1059: 	false ->
 1060: 	    ct:fail({permanent_child_not_restarted, Child1})
 1061:     end,
 1062:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1063: 
 1064: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1065: %% A transient child should not be restarted if it exits with reason
 1066: %% normal.
 1067: transient_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1068:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1069:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, transient, 1000,
 1070: 	      worker, []},
 1071: 
 1072:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1073: 
 1074:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, normal),
 1075: 
 1076:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1077:     [1,0,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1078: 
 1079: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1080: %% A temporary process should never be restarted.
 1081: temporary_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1082:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1083:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary, 1000,
 1084: 	      worker, []},
 1085: 
 1086:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1087: 
 1088:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, normal),
 1089: 
 1090:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1091:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1092: 
 1093: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1094: %% A permanent child should always be restarted.
 1095: permanent_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1096:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1097:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1098: 	      worker, []},
 1099: 
 1100:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1101: 
 1102:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, shutdown),
 1103: 
 1104:     [{child1, CPid2 ,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1105:     case is_pid(CPid2) of
 1106: 	true ->
 1107: 	    ok;
 1108: 	false ->
 1109: 	    ct:fail({permanent_child_not_restarted, Child1})
 1110:     end,
 1111:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1112: 
 1113:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child1, {shutdown, some_info}),
 1114: 
 1115:     [{child1, CPid3 ,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1116:     case is_pid(CPid3) of
 1117: 	true ->
 1118: 	    ok;
 1119: 	false ->
 1120: 	    ct:fail({permanent_child_not_restarted, Child1})
 1121:     end,
 1122: 
 1123:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1124: 
 1125: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1126: %% A transient child should not be restarted if it exits with reason
 1127: %% shutdown or {shutdown,Term}.
 1128: transient_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1129:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1130:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, transient, 1000,
 1131: 	      worker, []},
 1132: 
 1133:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1134: 
 1135:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, shutdown),
 1136: 
 1137:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1138:     [1,0,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1139: 
 1140:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
 1141: 
 1142:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child1, {shutdown, some_info}),
 1143: 
 1144:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1145:     [1,0,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1146: 
 1147: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1148: %% A temporary process should never be restarted.
 1149: temporary_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1150:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1151:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary, 1000,
 1152: 	      worker, []},
 1153: 
 1154:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1155: 
 1156:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, shutdown),
 1157: 
 1158:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1159:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1160: 
 1161:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1162: 
 1163:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child1, {shutdown, some_info}),
 1164: 
 1165:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1166:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1167: 
 1168: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1169: %% Faulty application should shutdown and pass on errors
 1170: faulty_application_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1171: 
 1172:     %% Set some paths
 1173:     AppDir  = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "app_faulty"),
 1174:     EbinDir = filename:join(AppDir, "ebin"),
 1175: 
 1176:     %% Start faulty app
 1177:     code:add_patha(EbinDir),
 1178: 
 1179:     %% {error,
 1180:     %%  {{shutdown,
 1181:     %%    {failed_to_start_child,
 1182:     %% 	app_faulty,
 1183:     %% 	{undef,
 1184:     %% 	 [{an_undefined_module_with,an_undefined_function,[argument1,argument2],
 1185:     %% 	   []},
 1186:     %% 	  {app_faulty_server,init,1,
 1187:     %% 	   [{file,"app_faulty/src/app_faulty_server.erl"},{line,16}]},
 1188:     %% 	  {gen_server,init_it,6,
 1189:     %% 	   [{file,"gen_server.erl"},{line,304}]},
 1190:     %% 	  {proc_lib,init_p_do_apply,3,
 1191:     %% 	   [{file,"proc_lib.erl"},{line,227}]}]}}},
 1192:     %%   {app_faulty,start,[normal,[]]}}}
 1193: 
 1194:     {error, Error} = application:start(app_faulty),
 1195:     {{shutdown, {failed_to_start_child,app_faulty,{undef, CallStack}}},
 1196:      {app_faulty,start,_}} = Error,
 1197:     [{an_undefined_module_with,an_undefined_function,_,_}|_] = CallStack,
 1198:     ok = application:unload(app_faulty),
 1199:     ok.
 1200: 
 1201: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1202: %% A permanent child should always be restarted.
 1203: permanent_abnormal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1204:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1205:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1206: 	      worker, []},
 1207: 
 1208:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1209:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1210: 
 1211:     [{child1, Pid ,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1212:     case is_pid(Pid) of
 1213: 	true ->
 1214: 	    ok;
 1215: 	false ->
 1216: 	    ct:fail({permanent_child_not_restarted, Child1})
 1217:     end,
 1218:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1219: 
 1220: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1221: %% A transient child should be restarted if it exits with reason abnormal.
 1222: transient_abnormal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1223:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1224:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, transient, 1000,
 1225: 	      worker, []},
 1226: 
 1227:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1228:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1229: 
 1230:     [{child1, Pid ,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1231:     case is_pid(Pid) of
 1232: 	true ->
 1233: 	    ok;
 1234: 	false ->
 1235: 	    ct:fail({transient_child_not_restarted, Child1})
 1236:     end,
 1237:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1238: 
 1239: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1240: %% A temporary process should never be restarted.
 1241: temporary_abnormal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1242:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1243:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary, 1000,
 1244: 	      worker, []},
 1245: 
 1246:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1247:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1248: 
 1249:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1250:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1251: 
 1252: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1253: %% A temporary process killed as part of a rest_for_one or one_for_all
 1254: %% restart strategy should not be restarted given its args are not
 1255: %% saved. Otherwise the supervisor hits its limit and crashes.
 1256: temporary_bystander(_Config) ->
 1257:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 100,
 1258: 	      worker, []},
 1259:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary, 100,
 1260: 	      worker, []},
 1261:     {ok, SupPid1} = supervisor:start_link(?MODULE, {ok, {{one_for_all, 2, 300}, []}}),
 1262:     {ok, SupPid2} = supervisor:start_link(?MODULE, {ok, {{rest_for_one, 2, 300}, []}}),
 1263:     unlink(SupPid1), % otherwise we crash with it
 1264:     unlink(SupPid2), % otherwise we crash with it
 1265:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(SupPid1, Child1),
 1266:     {ok, _CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(SupPid1, Child2),
 1267:     {ok, CPid3} = supervisor:start_child(SupPid2, Child1),
 1268:     {ok, _CPid4} = supervisor:start_child(SupPid2, Child2),
 1269:     terminate(SupPid1, CPid1, child1, normal),
 1270:     terminate(SupPid2, CPid3, child1, normal),
 1271:     timer:sleep(350),
 1272:     catch link(SupPid1),
 1273:     catch link(SupPid2),
 1274:     %% The supervisor would die attempting to restart child2
 1275:     true = erlang:is_process_alive(SupPid1),
 1276:     true = erlang:is_process_alive(SupPid2),
 1277:     %% Child2 has not been restarted
 1278:     [{child1, _, _, _}] = supervisor:which_children(SupPid1),
 1279:     [{child1, _, _, _}] = supervisor:which_children(SupPid2).
 1280: 
 1281: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1282: %% Test restarting a process multiple times, being careful not
 1283: %% to exceed the maximum restart frquency.
 1284: multiple_restarts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1285:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1286:     Child1 = #{id => child1,
 1287: 	       start => {supervisor_1, start_child, []},
 1288: 	       restart => permanent,
 1289: 	       shutdown => brutal_kill,
 1290: 	       type => worker,
 1291: 	       modules => []},
 1292:     SupFlags = #{strategy => one_for_one,
 1293: 		 intensity => 1,
 1294: 		 period => 1},
 1295:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {SupFlags, []}}),
 1296:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1297: 
 1298:     %% Terminate the process several times, but being careful
 1299:     %% not to exceed the maximum restart intensity.
 1300:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1301:     _ = [begin
 1302: 	     receive after 2100 -> ok end,
 1303: 	     [{_, Pid, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1304: 	     terminate(SupPid, Pid, child1, abnormal)
 1305: 	 end || _ <- [1,2,3]],
 1306: 
 1307:     %% Verify that the supervisor is still alive and clean up.
 1308:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(SupPid, child1),
 1309:     ok = supervisor:delete_child(SupPid, child1),
 1310:     exit(SupPid, kill),
 1311:     ok.
 1312: 
 1313: 
 1314: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1315: %% Test the one_for_one base case.
 1316: one_for_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1317:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1318:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1319: 	      worker, []},
 1320:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1321: 	      worker, []},
 1322:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1323:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1324:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
 1325: 
 1326:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1327:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1328:     if length(Children) == 2 ->
 1329: 	    case lists:keysearch(CPid2, 2, Children) of
 1330: 		{value, _} -> ok;
 1331: 		_ ->  ct:fail(bad_child)
 1332: 	    end;
 1333:        true ->  ct:fail({bad_child_list, Children})
 1334:     end,
 1335:     [2,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1336: 
 1337:     %% Test restart frequency property
 1338:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child2, abnormal),
 1339: 
 1340:     [{Id4, Pid4, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1341:     terminate(SupPid, Pid4, Id4, abnormal),
 1342:     check_exit([SupPid]).
 1343: 
 1344: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1345: %% Test restart escalation on a one_for_one supervisor.
 1346: one_for_one_escalation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1347:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1348: 
 1349:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [error]},
 1350: 	      permanent, 1000,
 1351: 	      worker, []},
 1352:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1353: 	      worker, []},
 1354: 
 1355:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 4, 3600}, []}}),
 1356:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1357:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
 1358:     link(CPid2),
 1359: 
 1360:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1361:     check_exit([SupPid, CPid2]).
 1362: 
 1363: 
 1364: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1365: %% Test the one_for_all base case.
 1366: one_for_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1367:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1368: 
 1369:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1370: 	     worker, []},
 1371:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1372: 	     worker, []},
 1373:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_all, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1374:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1375:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
 1376:     link(CPid2),
 1377: 
 1378:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1379:     check_exit([CPid2]),
 1380: 
 1381:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1382:     if length(Children) == 2 -> ok;
 1383:        true ->
 1384: 	    ct:fail({bad_child_list, Children})
 1385:     end,
 1386: 
 1387:     %% Test that no old children is still alive
 1388:     not_in_child_list([CPid1, CPid2], lists:map(fun({_,P,_,_}) -> P end, Children)),
 1389: 
 1390:     [2,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1391: 
 1392:     %%% Test restart frequency property
 1393:     [{Id3, Pid3, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1394:     terminate(SupPid, Pid3, Id3, abnormal),
 1395:     [{Id4, Pid4, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1396:     terminate(SupPid, Pid4, Id4, abnormal),
 1397:     check_exit([SupPid]).
 1398: 
 1399: 
 1400: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1401: %% Test restart escalation on a one_for_all supervisor.
 1402: one_for_all_escalation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1403:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1404: 
 1405:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1406: 	     worker, []},
 1407:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, [error]},
 1408: 	      permanent, 1000,
 1409: 	     worker, []},
 1410:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_all, 4, 3600}, []}}),
 1411:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1412:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
 1413:     link(CPid2),
 1414: 
 1415:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1416:     check_exit([CPid2, SupPid]).
 1417: 
 1418: 
 1419: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1420: %% Test that the supervisor terminates a restarted child when a different
 1421: %% child fails to start.
 1422: one_for_all_other_child_fails_restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1423:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1424:     Self = self(),
 1425:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_3, start_child, [child1, Self]},
 1426: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
 1427:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_3, start_child, [child2, Self]},
 1428: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
 1429:     Children = [Child1, Child2],
 1430:     StarterFun = fun() ->
 1431: 	    {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_all, 3, 3600}, Children}}),
 1432: 	    Self ! {sup_pid, SupPid},
 1433: 	    receive {stop, Self} -> ok end
 1434:     end,
 1435:     StarterPid = spawn_link(StarterFun),
 1436:     Ok = {{ok, undefined}, Self},
 1437:     %% Let the children start.
 1438:     Child1Pid = receive {child1, Pid1} -> Pid1 end,
 1439:     Child1Pid ! Ok,
 1440:     Child2Pid = receive {child2, Pid2} -> Pid2 end,
 1441:     Child2Pid ! Ok,
 1442:     %% Supervisor started.
 1443:     SupPid = receive {sup_pid, Pid} -> Pid end,
 1444:     link(SupPid),
 1445:     exit(Child1Pid, die),
 1446:     %% Let child1 restart but don't let child2.
 1447:     Child1Pid2  = receive {child1, Pid3} -> Pid3 end,
 1448:     Child1Pid2Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Child1Pid2),
 1449:     Child1Pid2 ! Ok,
 1450:     Child2Pid2 = receive {child2, Pid4} -> Pid4 end,
 1451:     Child2Pid2 ! {{stop, normal}, Self},
 1452:     %% Check child1 is terminated.
 1453:     receive
 1454: 	{'DOWN', Child1Pid2Ref, _, _, shutdown} ->
 1455: 	    ok;
 1456: 	{_childName, _Pid} ->
 1457: 	    exit(SupPid, kill),
 1458: 	    check_exit([StarterPid, SupPid]),
 1459: 	    ct:fail({restarting_child_not_terminated, Child1Pid2})
 1460:     end,
 1461:     %% Let the restart complete.
 1462:     Child1Pid3 = receive {child1, Pid5} -> Pid5 end,
 1463:     Child1Pid3 ! Ok,
 1464:     Child2Pid3 = receive {child2, Pid6} -> Pid6 end,
 1465:     Child2Pid3 ! Ok,
 1466:     StarterPid ! {stop, Self},
 1467:     check_exit([StarterPid, SupPid]).
 1468: 
 1469: 
 1470: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1471: %% Test the simple_one_for_one base case.
 1472: simple_one_for_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1473:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1474:     Child = {child, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1475: 	     worker, []},
 1476:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
 1477:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1478:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1479: 
 1480:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1481: 
 1482:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1483:     if length(Children) == 2 ->
 1484: 	    case lists:keysearch(CPid2, 2, Children) of
 1485: 		{value, _} -> ok;
 1486: 		_ ->  ct:fail(bad_child)
 1487: 	    end;
 1488:        true ->  ct:fail({bad_child_list, Children})
 1489:     end,
 1490:     [1,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1491: 
 1492:     %% Test restart frequency property
 1493:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child2, abnormal),
 1494: 
 1495:     [{Id4, Pid4, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1496: 
 1497:     terminate(SupPid, Pid4, Id4, abnormal),
 1498:     check_exit_reason(SupPid,shutdown).
 1499: 
 1500: 
 1501: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1502: %% Test simple_one_for_one children shutdown accordingly to the
 1503: %% supervisor's shutdown strategy.
 1504: simple_one_for_one_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1505:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1506:     ShutdownTime = 1000,
 1507:     Child = {child, {supervisor_2, start_child, []},
 1508:              permanent, 2*ShutdownTime, worker, []},
 1509:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
 1510: 
 1511:     %% Will be gracefully shutdown
 1512:     {ok, _CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, [ShutdownTime]),
 1513:     {ok, _CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, [ShutdownTime]),
 1514: 
 1515:     %% Will be killed after 2*ShutdownTime milliseconds
 1516:     {ok, _CPid3} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, [5*ShutdownTime]),
 1517: 
 1518:     {T, ok} = timer:tc(fun terminate/2, [SupPid, shutdown]),
 1519:     if T < 1000*ShutdownTime ->
 1520:             %% Because supervisor's children wait before exiting, it can't
 1521:             %% terminate quickly
 1522:             ct:fail({shutdown_too_short, T});
 1523:        T >= 1000*5*ShutdownTime ->
 1524:             ct:fail({shutdown_too_long, T});
 1525:        true ->
 1526:             check_exit([SupPid])
 1527:     end.
 1528: 
 1529: 
 1530: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1531: %% Tests automatic restart of children who's start function return
 1532: %% extra info.
 1533: simple_one_for_one_extra(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1534:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1535:     Child = {child, {supervisor_1, start_child, [extra_info]}, 
 1536: 	     permanent, 1000, worker, []},
 1537:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
 1538:     {ok, CPid1, extra_info} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1539:     {ok, CPid2, extra_info} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1540:     link(CPid2),
 1541:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1542:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1543:     if length(Children) == 2 ->
 1544: 	    case lists:keysearch(CPid2, 2, Children) of
 1545: 		{value, _} -> ok;
 1546: 		_ ->  ct:fail(bad_child)
 1547: 	    end;
 1548:        true ->  ct:fail({bad_child_list, Children})
 1549:     end,
 1550:     [1,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1551:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child2, abnormal),
 1552:     [{Id4, Pid4, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1553:     terminate(SupPid, Pid4, Id4, abnormal),
 1554:     check_exit([SupPid]).
 1555: 
 1556: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1557: %% Test for subtle corruption of internal state for a
 1558: %% simple_one_for_one supervisor. Thanks to Zeyu Zhang (@zzydxm) and
 1559: %% Maxim Fedorov for noticing this bug. (OTP-16804)
 1560: simple_one_for_one_corruption(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1561:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1562: 
 1563:     logger:add_handler(?MODULE, ?MODULE, #{test_case_pid => self()}),
 1564: 
 1565:     try
 1566:         Child = #{id => child, start => {supervisor_1, start_child, []},
 1567:                   restart => temporary, shutdown => 1000,
 1568:                   type => worker, modules => []},
 1569:         {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
 1570:         {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1571: 
 1572:         terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1573: 
 1574:         %% The first time a child of simple_one_for_one supervisor
 1575:         %% with restart strategy `temporary` dies, the internal state
 1576:         %% for the supervisor will become inconsistent (the `dynamics`
 1577:         %% field would change from `{mapsets,Map}` to
 1578:         %% `{maps,Map}`). That inconsistency will make the supervisor
 1579:         %% retain the start arguments even for temporary processes.
 1580:         %%
 1581:         %% To test that the bug is fixed, start a new child process
 1582:         %% with a large term in its argument list.
 1583: 
 1584:         N = 50000,
 1585:         BigData = binary_to_list(<<0:N/unit:8>>),
 1586:         {ok, CPid2, BigData} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, [BigData]),
 1587: 
 1588:         %% Since the child is temporary, the supervisor should not keep
 1589:         %% the argument list for the child and the supervisor's heap
 1590:         %% size should shrink after a GC.
 1591: 
 1592:         true = erlang:garbage_collect(SupPid),
 1593:         {total_heap_size, HeapSize} = process_info(SupPid, total_heap_size),
 1594:         if
 1595:             HeapSize > 2*N ->
 1596:                 %% The start arguments for the child have been kept.
 1597:                 ct:fail({excessive_heap_size,HeapSize});
 1598:             true ->
 1599:                 ok
 1600:         end,
 1601: 
 1602:         terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child2, abnormal),
 1603: 
 1604:         exit(SupPid, kill)
 1605:     after
 1606:         logger:remove_handler(?MODULE)
 1607:     end,
 1608: 
 1609:     ok.
 1610: 
 1611: 
 1612: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1613: %% Test restart escalation on a simple_one_for_one supervisor.
 1614: simple_one_for_one_escalation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1615:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1616:     Child = {child, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1617: 	     worker, []},
 1618:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 4, 3600}, [Child]}}),
 1619:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, [error]),
 1620:     link(CPid1),
 1621:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1622:     link(CPid2),
 1623: 
 1624:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child, abnormal),
 1625:     check_exit([SupPid, CPid2]).
 1626: 
 1627: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1628: %% Test the rest_for_one base case.
 1629: rest_for_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1630:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1631:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1632: 	     worker, []},
 1633:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1634: 	     worker, []},
 1635:     Child3 = {child3, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1636: 	     worker, []},
 1637:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{rest_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1638:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1639:     link(CPid1),
 1640:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
 1641:     {ok, CPid3} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child3),
 1642:     link(CPid3),
 1643:     [3,3,0,3] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1644: 
 1645:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child2, abnormal),
 1646: 
 1647:     %% Check that Cpid3 did die
 1648:     check_exit([CPid3]),
 1649: 
 1650:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1651:     is_in_child_list([CPid1], Children),
 1652: 
 1653:     if length(Children) == 3 ->
 1654: 	    ok;
 1655:        true ->
 1656: 	    ct:fail({bad_child_list, Children})
 1657:     end,
 1658:     [3,3,0,3] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1659: 
 1660:     %% Test that no old children is still alive
 1661:     Pids = lists:map(fun({_,P,_,_}) -> P end, Children),
 1662:     not_in_child_list([CPid2, CPid3], Pids),
 1663:     in_child_list([CPid1], Pids),
 1664: 
 1665:     %% Test restart frequency property
 1666:     [{child3, Pid3, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1667: 
 1668:     terminate(SupPid, Pid3, child3, abnormal),
 1669: 
 1670:     [_,{child2, Pid4, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1671: 
 1672:     terminate(SupPid, Pid4, child2, abnormal),
 1673:     check_exit([SupPid]).
 1674: 
 1675: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1676: %% Test restart escalation on a rest_for_one supervisor.
 1677: rest_for_one_escalation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1678:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1679:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1680: 	     worker, []},
 1681:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, [error]},
 1682: 	      permanent, 1000,
 1683: 	     worker, []},
 1684:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{rest_for_one, 4, 3600}, []}}),
 1685:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1686:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
 1687:     link(CPid2),
 1688: 
 1689:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1690:     check_exit([CPid2, SupPid]).
 1691: 
 1692: 
 1693: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1694: %% Test that the supervisor terminates a restarted child when a different
 1695: %% child fails to start.
 1696: rest_for_one_other_child_fails_restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1697:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1698:     Self = self(),
 1699:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_3, start_child, [child1, Self]},
 1700: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
 1701:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_3, start_child, [child2, Self]},
 1702: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
 1703:     Children = [Child1, Child2],
 1704:     StarterFun = fun() ->
 1705: 	    {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{rest_for_one, 3, 3600}, Children}}),
 1706: 	    Self ! {sup_pid, SupPid},
 1707: 	    receive {stop, Self} -> ok end
 1708:     end,
 1709:     StarterPid = spawn_link(StarterFun),
 1710:     Ok = {{ok, undefined}, Self},
 1711:     %% Let the children start.
 1712:     Child1Pid = receive {child1, Pid1} -> Pid1 end,
 1713:     Child1Pid ! Ok,
 1714:     Child2Pid = receive {child2, Pid2} -> Pid2 end,
 1715:     Child2Pid ! Ok,
 1716:     %% Supervisor started.
 1717:     SupPid = receive {sup_pid, Pid} -> Pid end,
 1718:     link(SupPid),
 1719:     exit(Child1Pid, die),
 1720:     %% Let child1 restart but don't let child2.
 1721:     Child1Pid2  = receive {child1, Pid3} -> Pid3 end,
 1722:     Child1Pid2 ! Ok,
 1723:     Child2Pid2 = receive {child2, Pid4} -> Pid4 end,
 1724:     Child2Pid2 ! {{stop, normal}, Self},
 1725: 	%% Let child2 restart.
 1726:     receive
 1727: 	{child2, Child2Pid3} ->
 1728: 	    Child2Pid3 ! Ok;
 1729: 	{child1, _Child1Pid3} ->
 1730: 	    exit(SupPid, kill),
 1731: 	    check_exit([StarterPid, SupPid]),
 1732: 	    ct:fail({restarting_started_child, Child1Pid2})
 1733:     end,
 1734:     StarterPid ! {stop, Self},
 1735:     check_exit([StarterPid, SupPid]).
 1736: 
 1737: 
 1738: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1739: %% Test that the supervisor does not hang forever if the child unliks
 1740: %% and then is terminated by the supervisor.
 1741: child_unlink(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1742: 
 1743:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1744: 
 1745:     Child = {naughty_child, {naughty_child,
